Text.Value: How did you end up in that vault? Aren't you zerai ultimate warriors?
How did you end up in that vault? Githzerai are supposed to be ultimate warriors.
Come now. You're as much a prisoner of this place as I. Let us aid one another.
Or perhaps not. Death, freedom - they are one and the same.
If you want my help, then tell me the truth.
My people dwell in Limbo - a realm of pure, chaotic thought. With my mind gone, perhaps my soul will return there.
I'm not sure I can - I have no psionic power.
Warriors of the mind. Oh, there's some physical prowess involved, but the battlefield on which we truly fight the ghaik is their own.
Why? This form fits you so much better, cousin.
Well, a githyanki skull would be too tight a fit, cousin. Your people shunned psionics, after all - while mine mastered them.
Reach out and erase her mind.
*The monk-like githzerai, sibling-race to the warrior githyanki. Their contempt for one another is eclipsed only by their shared hatred of the illithids.*
Thank you, I - wait.
Leave.
You want me to kill you. What if I can free you instead?
Pretty enough for a flesh-prison - if not the noble githzerai features I was born with.
...All right. I... the ghaik did not find my monastery. I led them there.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Veneer of sanity immediately shatters - agitated and pleading

Text.Value: You called yourself 'githzerai'. Is that some kind of githyanki?

EditorData.NodeContext: Completely vacant - we've wiped his mind

Text.Value: PLEASE!
Touch my mind, and purge it - at the very moment you do, I will make my knowledge yours.
Reach out and purge her mind.
Return with one who bears this gift, then. Please.
HmmMM... fine bones... sharp jaw... some variety of elf?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Working jaw, flitting through expressions as if testing the face out

Text.Value: Leave.
...A terrible fate, to be born without a high-mind. It was the one gift the ghaik truly gave us.
No. NO. PLEASE!
*As her agitation swells, so does her latent psionic power. To your tadpole, that guilt and terror are almost... fragrant.*
*You catch the lie - the monk isn't telling everything.*
*You realise the illithids locked her away not as a trophy, but as a fine vintage.*
*A prickling flame runs across the back of your mind and the edge of your soul.*
*An unusually cautious faerie tickle runs across the back of your mind and the edge of your soul.*
*You feel the oncoming void tug at the back of your mind and the edge of your soul.*
I'm listening. What aid are you offering?
*It fades beneath your touch, but you feel something left behind. A fragment.*
Please - touch my mind, and purge it. The moment you do, my knowledge will be yours.
Use your tadpole. Erase me - and I will pass my technique onto you.
*The awareness that floods you is nothing like the tadpole. It is tentative, and tinged with the loneliness of aeons.*
It is my mind they enslave. It is my mind that must die.
Only because I haven't told you how you will benefit.
Warriors of the mind, cousin. A discipline unknown to your kind - and the very reason we were attacked.
I'm not interested.
*The monk-like githzerai, sibling race to your own githyanki. The only beings your people hate more are the illithids themselves.*
I'll do it.
My order taught a psionic technique much-feared by the ghaik. They destroyed us for it, and kept me as a trophy.
They promised me immortality. And they gave it - I have been their rotting trophy for centuries.
...I do not. The ghaik have been warping flesh for millennia - who knows what damage they can undo.
Only we zerai continue the war to end the ghaik forever. Only we fight them their own battlefield - the mind.
When you say 'erase' your mind - do by any chance mean 'smash your brain to bits'?
It is only knowledge yet, without comprehension. But when you use it, you will... see...
I'd guess you're no willing guest of the ghaik either. Perhaps we might aid one another.
*Your patron bids you caution before agreeing to this pact. The monk isn't telling you everything.*
A githzerai's mind is not so easily cracked. Our discipline was the very reason we were attacked.
You're remarkably sane for a pickled brain.
I'm not sure I can - I have no psionic power.
And I... I see...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The face falls mid-sentence, conciousness gone

Text.Value: Reach out and consume her mind.
Erase me. Please. My knowledge will be yours.
I never broke, but... I've spent all these centuries awake. Aware. So here is my offer:
Oh, for a set of hands to slap your face. The yanki lost their way the moment Gith threw down the ghaik empire.

Synopsis: One of the memories available in the Colony "Brain Reader", found in the Vault.
